articles.headline: GBA orders mandatory fire safety measures following Chickpet incident
articles.summary: Chief Commissioner Maheshwar Rao has directed the formation of a committee to investigate the Chickpet fire. The authority has ordered mandatory fire extinguishers in commercial buildings and will disconnect power to unauthorized structures.

articles.headline: Job protest organizers booked for law violations in Dharwad
articles.summary: Police have registered a case against the AKSSA president for staging a protest without permission on February 24. Protesters were involved in clashes with police and road blockades during the massive demonstration.

articles.headline: Supreme Court decries gender discrimination in access to open prisons
articles.summary: The apex court ruled that denying women prisoners access to open correctional institutions is a violation of their right to dignity and equality. States and UTs were directed to restructure facilities to allocate adequate capacity for women.

articles.headline: Gauhati High Court issues notice to Assam CM over hate speech
articles.summary: The court issued a notice to Himanta Biswa Sarma following petitions alleging he targeted Muslims in his public statements. The petitions were filed by the Congress and Assamese scholars regarding his comments on the 'miya' community.

articles.headline: Center grants sanction to prosecute P Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis case
articles.summary: The government has authorized the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute the former finance minister for allegedly clearing a $800 million FDI deal fraudulently. The ED has moved a special court to expedite the trial.

articles.headline: Kerala High Court reserves verdict on release of Kerala Story 2
articles.summary: A division bench has reserved its decision on a stay against the film's release scheduled for February 27. A single judge previously put the film on hold, citing potential disruption to communal harmony.

articles.headline: Bengaluru bar ordered to refund service charge and pay compensation
articles.summary: A consumer court in Bengaluru ruled that an automatic 10% service charge levied by a bar was an unfair trade practice. The establishment was ordered to refund the charge and pay Rs 7,000 in damages to the customer.

articles.headline: Eleven arrested for abducting and assaulting film director in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Police arrested 11 individuals for the abduction and brutal assault of a Kannada film director over a financial dispute. The suspects allegedly robbed the victim of cash and gold ornaments after luring him to a garage.

articles.headline: Chief Justice Vows Registry Reforms After Dismissed Plea was Relisted
articles.summary: CJI Surya Kant expressed shock after a petition previously dismissed by a three-judge bench was listed again before a different bench. The court has ordered an administrative probe into the Supreme Court registry officials responsible for the error.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Seeks Response on PIL Against Political Money Power
articles.summary: A three-member bench has issued notices to the Centre and Election Commission regarding unregulated campaign spending by political parties. The petition argues that unchecked political funding distorts the democratic process and violates constitutional principles.

articles.headline: ED Files Sanction Orders Against P Chidambaram in Money Laundering Case
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate has received prosecution sanctions against former Finance Minister P Chidambaram regarding the Aircel Maxis and INX Media deals. The agency alleges illegal gratification was demand and received through shell companies controlled by Karti Chidambaram.

articles.headline: Black Money Act Cannot Be Imposed on forced Residents
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court stayed a tax office demand for foreign asset disclosure from a businessman extradited to India. The ruling prevents the taxman from invoking the Black Money Act solely because a person's involuntary stay exceeds 181 days.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Bench Calls Tribunals a Liability and Headache for Government
articles.summary: A bench led by CJI Surya Kant criticized tribunals for being unaccountable and failing to learn commercial or environmental laws. The court revealed instances of outsourced judgment writing and called for a new mechanism to regulate tribunal functioning.

articles.headline: ED grills Anil Ambani for nine hours in bank fraud case
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate questioned Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani regarding an alleged ~40,000 crore bank fraud linked to RCom. This marks the second round of questioning for the 66-year-old industrialist under money laundering provisions.

articles.headline: ED files for prosecution sanction against Congress leader P Chidambaram
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate is seeking an expeditious trial against P Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis and INX Media money laundering cases. This follows a Supreme Court directive requiring mandatory sanction for prosecution in PMLA chargesheets.

articles.headline: Ibbi mandates recording homebuyer details in insolvency information memorandums
articles.summary: The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India now requires that companies undergoing insolvency include details of all allottees in their records. This ensures fair treatment for homebuyers whose names appear in company books or RERA records even without submitted claims.

articles.headline: Supreme Court rules against one-sided builder-buyer agreements for homebuyers
articles.summary: The apex court ruled that developers cannot use restrictive clauses to cap compensation for delayed possession. The judgment emphasizes that statutory consumer protections override terms in agreements that undermine buyer rights.

articles.headline: Karnataka Cabinet approves filling 56,432 government posts under old quota
articles.summary: The state government decided to recruit for over 56,000 vacancies using the previous 50% reservation matrix following a high court stay on the 2022 Act. The decision follows massive protests by job aspirants in Dharwad regarding long-standing vacancies.

articles.headline: Governor gives assent to Karnataka internal reservation bill
articles.summary: Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot approved the Karnataka Scheduled Castes (Sub-Classification) Bill, 2025. The bill implements a 6-6-5 reservation formula within the SC quota for state recruitment and admissions.

articles.headline: DCM Shivakumar says guarantee schemes are a financial burden
articles.summary: Deputy CM D K Shivakumar stated that while the five guarantee schemes cost the state Rs 52,000 crore annually, there is no question of stopping them. Some leaders suggested weeding out affluent beneficiaries to reduce the strain.

articles.headline: India and Israel upgrade ties to special strategic partnership
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Benjamin Netanyahu signed 16 MoUs covering AI, education, and labor mobility after a bilateral meeting. Both nations reaffirmed commitments to defense cooperation and the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor.

articles.headline: Karnataka internal reservation bill approved as state fills 56k vacancies
articles.summary: The Karnataka Governor has given assent to the internal reservation bill for SC and ST sub-categorization. Simultaneously, the state government decided to fill over 56,000 vacancies, subject to the final verdict of the High Court.

articles.headline: Expelled AIADMK veteran O Panneerselvam likely to join DMK
articles.summary: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam is expected to join the DMK today after being excluded from AIADMK leadership. He may contest from his traditional seat of Bodinayakkanur in the upcoming assembly elections.

articles.headline: Cybercrime case filed over derogatory remarks against Home Minister G Parameshwara
articles.summary: A complaint was lodged regarding social media comments targeting the Karnataka Home Minister and his family. The remarks were posted on a Facebook page following a video of a recent legislature session.

articles.headline: Kerala police find no visual proof of assault on Health Minister
articles.summary: Railway police stated that there is currently no CCTV or mobile footage to substantiate claims that Minister Veena George was attacked. Opposition leaders maintain the allegations are unfounded and politically motivated.

articles.headline: Bipartisan Parliamentary Friendship Groups to boost India and Israel ties
articles.summary: PM Modi endorsed the use of newly formed bipartisan parliamentary groups to strengthen relations between Indian and Israeli lawmakers. These groups are designed to project a united national stand on matters of international interest.

articles.headline: Congress claims PM Modi's Knesset address diminished India's moral standing
articles.summary: The Congress party criticized the Prime Minister's speech in Israel, characterizing it as an 'unabashed defense' of Benjamin Netanyahu. They argued the address ignored historical rights of the Arab population in the region.

articles.headline: Angela Merkel states US actions have weakened global organisations
articles.summary: Former German Chancellor Angela Merkel criticized the US for undermining multilateralism and the concept of territorial integrity. During a lecture in New Delhi, she warned that 'might means right' is replacing the previous international order.

articles.headline: Analysis critiques Trumpian views on Western civilization and transatlantic history
articles.summary: This political commentary examines secretarial rhetoric regarding the 'sacred inheritance' of Western civilization and its impact on modern diplomacy. It contrasts unilateral American viewpoints with the historical realities of European development and native displacement.

articles.headline: PM Narendra Modi becomes first world leader with 100 million Instagram followers
articles.summary: Prime Minister Modi reached a digital milestone by becoming the first politician to cross 100 million followers on Instagram. His following is more than double that of any other active world leader on the platform.

articles.headline: MVA Partners Negotiate Rajya Sabha and Council Seat Nominations
articles.summary: The Maha Vikas Aghadi is discussing a formula to field Sharad Pawar for the Rajya Sabha and Uddhav Thackeray for the Legislative Council. Both Shiv Sena (UBT) and Congress have also staked claims for the lone winnable Rajya Sabha seat.

articles.headline: Modi and Mark Carney to chart road map for bilateral ties
articles.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will visit India for four days to normalize relations and discuss trade, energy, and technology. Both leaders will attend the India-Canada CEOs Forum to reaffirm positive momentum in the strategic partnership.

articles.headline: Cauvery Stage 6 project approved at cost of Rs 6,939 crore
articles.summary: The Karnataka Cabinet cleared the Cauvery Stage 6 water project to supply an additional 500 MLD of water to Bengaluru. The project will primarily serve surrounding areas including Devanahalli, Hoskote, and Nelamangala.

articles.headline: BEML delivers third trainset for Bengaluru Metro Pink Line
articles.summary: The third train for the upcoming Pink Line has arrived at the Kothanur depot for assembly and inspections. BMRCL aims to open the 7.5-km Kalena Agrahara-Taverekere section by May 2026.

articles.headline: Residents flag garbage and illegal construction at GBA public meeting
articles.summary: During the first public grievance meeting, citizens raised 65 complaints regarding waste mismanagement and building violations. GBA officials directed engineers to resolve 60% of the complaints within a week.

articles.headline: Transport Minister claims 10,000 vacancies filled since 2023
articles.summary: Minister Ramalinga Reddy stated that the department has completed 1,000 compassionate appointments and numerous regular recruitments in 2.5 years. He accused the previous BJP government of stalling recruitment for 13,900 posts.

articles.headline: Bengaluru residents raise waste collection and park maintenance issues with GBA
articles.summary: During a public interaction, GBA Chief Commissioner Maheshwar Rao addressed complaints regarding garbage collection and poorly maintained playgrounds. He promised that at least 20% of the issues would be resolved within days.

articles.headline: Fire officials claim 99 percent of market area buildings lack NOC
articles.summary: A senior official stated that nearly all buildings in Bengaluru's congested market localities do not have fire safety clearances. Narrow lanes and illegal constructions continue to pose major hurdles for emergency response teams.

articles.headline: Bengaluru to Hyderabad rail travel to be faster from next month
articles.summary: The commissioning of a doubled 30-km rail stretch in Andhra Pradesh will allow for faster travel between Bengaluru and Hyderabad. The track has been authorized for operation at a maximum speed of 110 kmph.

articles.headline: Jeep India Reintroduces Limited Edition Wrangler Willys 41 SUV
articles.summary: Only 41 units of the heritage-inspired vehicle are available, featuring military decals and heavy-duty off-road components. The model is powered by a 2.0-litre engine delivering 270 bhp.

articles.headline: Nissan Motor India Launches All-New 7-Seater Gravite MPV
articles.summary: The new vehicle features LED treatment, flexible seating solutions, and a piano black grille. Prices for the MPV start at Rs 5.65 lakh at ex-showroom rates.

articles.headline: Volkswagen Announces Pricing for Premium Tayron R-Line SUV in India
articles.summary: The new flagship model is priced at Rs 47 lakh and features Level 2 ADAS safety systems. It comes equipped with a 15-inch infotainment screen and Matrix LED headlamps.

articles.headline: Audi Introduces RS 5 Sport Plug-In Hybrid With Twin-Turbo V6
articles.summary: The high-performance hybrid pairs a twin-turbo V6 engine with an electric motor for 510 PS output. It features world-first electro-mechanical torque vectoring and an OLED curved display.

articles.headline: DGCA Introduces 48-Hour Free Flight Ticket Cancellation Window
articles.summary: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has announced new rules allowing passengers to cancel or amend flight bookings without penalty within 48 hours. The facility applies to tickets booked directly through airline websites at least seven days before domestic travel.

articles.headline: Rail Tech Policy Launched to Promote Innovation and Startups
articles.summary: The Indian Railways has unveiled a new tech policy to engage startups and institutions in solving operational challenges. Innovations being sought include AI-based elephant intrusion detection, broken rail sensors, and solar panels for train coaches.

articles.headline: Tata Motors to deploy 40 green hydrogen trucks at VOC Port
articles.summary: Tata Motors signed a pact to deploy 40 hydrogen-powered heavy-duty trucks at Tuticorn's V O Chidambaranar Port. The project will begin with trials of hydrogen prime movers followed by phased deployment over two years.

articles.headline: DGCA launches 48-hour free cancellation window for air tickets
articles.summary: A new regulation effective March 26 allows airline passengers to cancel or change tickets within 48 hours of booking without additional charges. The DGCA also standardized refund timelines, requiring credit card refunds to be processed within seven working days.

articles.headline: Govt to soon launch grade-based driving licence system says Gadkari
articles.summary: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari announced a plan to introduce a graded point system for driving licences to improve road safety. Under the scheme, points will be deducted for traffic violations, leading to potential licence suspension or cancellation.

articles.headline: Memory chip shortage expected to increase mobile and PC prices
articles.summary: Global prices for smartphones and PCs are projected to rise by up to 17% due to a massive shortage of DRAM and SSD components. The shortage is attributed to the redirection of manufacturing capacity toward high-bandwidth memory for AI infrastructure.

articles.headline: Ashwini Vaishnaw says digital platforms must take responsibility for content
articles.summary: The Union Minister asserted that platforms are obligated to ensure the online safety of children and protect against fake AI-generated content. He emphasized that trust in societal institutions is currently under threat from unregulated digital material.

articles.headline: Instagram to alert parents when children search for self-harm terms
articles.summary: Instagram will begin notifying parents if their children repeatedly search for terms related to suicide or self-harm. These alerts are specifically for parents enrolled in the platform's parental supervision programme.

articles.headline: UIDAI partners with Google to show Aadhaar centres on Maps
articles.summary: Locating authorized Aadhaar centers will become easier as UIDAI collaborates with Google to display verified locations on Google Maps. The feature will include details on services offered, operating hours, and accessibility features.

articles.headline: Indian Army upgrades T-72 tanks with advanced fire control technology
articles.summary: The Army has completed the installation of Thermal Imaging Fire Control Systems on 96 T-72 tanks to improve night-fighting capabilities. The technology was developed through a partnership between a Bengaluru-based firm and Israel's Elbit Systems.

articles.headline: Vivo Launches X200T Smartphone Featuring Zeiss Triple Camera Setup
articles.summary: The new mid-premium flagship offers a Dimensity 9400+ chipset and a 6.67-inch AMOLED display. Key features include a 50MP primary camera, 90W fast charging, and IP69 water resistance.

articles.headline: Apple Releases Second Generation AirTag With Improved Precision Finding
articles.summary: The new tracking device features an upgraded Ultra-Wideband chip for better distance and volume performance. It retains the original form factor while offering enhanced integration with the Find My app.

articles.headline: Nike Releases ACG Ultrafly Trail Racing Shoes for Outdoor Runners
articles.summary: The new footwear features ZoomX foam and a full-length carbon plate for energy return on rough terrain. It includes a Vibram Megagrip outsole designed for traction in all weather.

articles.headline: Fender Audio Launches Portable Elie 12 Bluetooth Speaker for Musicians
articles.summary: The 120W speaker features dual sound chambers and physical controls for treble and bass. It is designed for multi-source audio integration and offers a 15-hour battery life.

articles.headline: Haier Introduces Gravity AI Series Air Conditioners With Smart Cooling
articles.summary: The new AC range utilizes Hexa-Inverters and AI technology to optimize energy usage based on user habits. It features supersonic cooling that reaches desired temperatures in 10 seconds.

articles.headline: Xiaomi Debuts 75-Inch QLED X Pro TV With Dolby Vision Support
articles.summary: The large-screen TV features a 97.76 percent screen-to-body ratio and 4K UHD resolution. It is powered by a Quad Core A55 processor and includes 34W box speakers.

articles.headline: Vivo Unveils V70 Elite Smartphone With Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 Processor
articles.summary: The aesthetic device runs on Android 16 and features Zeiss cameras and a 1.5K AMOLED display. It includes IP69 resistance and a large 6500 mAh battery.

articles.headline: Infinix Note Edge Launched With Curved AMOLED Screen and JBL Sound
articles.summary: The new smartphone features a MediaTek Dimensity 7100 processor and a 50MP AI rear camera. It offers five years of security updates and a long-lasting battery.

articles.headline: Smartphone Makers May Receive PLI Scheme 2.0 Incentives
articles.summary: The Indian government is considering a second round of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for smartphones to maintain manufacturing momentum. Officials are discussing exceptions to help domestic manufacturers remain competitive against China following shifts in global tariff dynamics.

articles.headline: Advanced Chip Packaging Offers Entry into Semiconductor Value Chain
articles.summary: Applied Materials executive Prabhu Raja states that advanced packaging of chips is a key opportunity for India to enter the global semiconductor market. The shift toward 3D chip scaling and materials engineering is reducing the traditional dominance of lithography.

articles.headline: Karnataka Working on Ethical AI Framework and Regulatory Sandbox
articles.summary: Additional Chief Secretary Gaurav Gupta announced that Karnataka is developing an ethical AI framework to promote safe and trusted technology. The state’s IT Policy 2025-30 has earmarked ₹1,000 crore in incentives to boost the sector's contribution to state GVA.

articles.headline: TattvamAI secures $1.7 million pre-seed to automate chip design
articles.summary: Deep tech startup TattvamAI raised $1.7 million in a funding round led by Seedcamp to build AI systems for semiconductor design. The startup aims to solve complex reasoning problems in chip architecture that standard large language models struggle with.

articles.headline: Sedemac eyes global market for proprietary starter generator technology
articles.summary: Pune-based Sedemac Mechatronics is in talks with OEMs in North America and Europe to export its sensorless motor control technology. The firm’s revenue rose to ~771 crore for the first nine months of fiscal 2026, with a profit of ~71.5 crore.

articles.headline: Citizen-level AI adoption to boost innovation in India says Uniphore CEO
articles.summary: Uniphore CEO Umesh Sachdev stated that India has the potential to lead the world in AI adoption by solving unique local problems at scale. The company reported 100 percent year-on-year growth for the past two years and expects to cross $1 billion in bookings.

articles.headline: Cognizant AI chief says threat to large IT firms is overblown
articles.summary: Babak Hodjat of Cognizant argued that automated AI tools will not replace large IT services firms because clients still need help with engineering and integration. Rival firms like TCS and Wipro also maintain that AI adoption will boost rather than shrink demand for software services.

articles.headline: OpenAI says ChatGPT refused to assist Chinese influence operations
articles.summary: OpenAI reported that its service refused requests from an individual linked to Chinese law enforcement to plan a campaign discrediting the Japanese Prime Minister. The company gathered evidence of a sustained effort by Chinese authorities to suppress dissent using AI.

articles.headline: Chickpet fire destroys 21 shops sparking safety policy review
articles.summary: A massive fire at a hardware shop in Kumbarpet destroyed 21 shops on Wednesday, highlighting accessibility issues for fire tenders in narrow lanes. Urban planners are urging the government to revive water hydrants and implement phased redevelopment.

articles.headline: Housekeeper found murdered in south-eastern Bengaluru farmland
articles.summary: A 25-year-old mother of two, Sonali Khatun, was found strangled in a farmland near Varthur. Police have launched a murder investigation and suspect she was killed while returning from work.

articles.headline: CCB identifies illegal foreigners in special Bengaluru search drive
articles.summary: Bengaluru police questioned nearly 2,000 foreign nationals to verify visa status and registration details. Legal action and deportation proceedings are being initiated against those residing without valid documentation.

articles.headline: Rowdy-sheeter hacked to death in front of mother in Sampigehalli
articles.summary: A 28-year-old man, Pavan Kumar, was attacked by a gang on motorcycles armed with lethal weapons. Police believe the murder was motivated by old enmity and have formed a special team to trace the suspects.

articles.headline: Female actor among eleven arrested for kidnapping film director
articles.summary: Adugodi police arrested a gang, including actress Aishwarya, for kidnapping and assaulting a debutant director over a financial dispute. The victim was robbed of cash and gold after being lured to Bengaluru from Mumbai.

articles.headline: Bengaluru policy on regulation of ferocious dog breeds put on hold
articles.summary: The regulation of 24 dog breeds identified as dangerous in Bengaluru is currently on hold as authorities await recommendations from municipal corporations. The policy follows a March 2024 government notice regarding public safety and pet ownership.

articles.headline: Bengaluru police launch drive to verify details of foreign tenants
articles.summary: Authorities have directed landlords to mandatorily share details of foreign nationals residing in their properties. The special drive includes checking visa validity and registration status with the Foreigners' Regional Registration Office.

articles.headline: Gold worth over one crore stolen from residence in Hebbal
articles.summary: Gold ornaments weighing 816 grams were reported missing from a home in Bengaluru's Hebbal locality. Police suspect a family member may be involved and have detained one person for questioning.

articles.headline: Woman housekeeper found murdered near agricultural field in Whitefield
articles.summary: A 30-year-old woman was found strangled to death in Siddapura after leaving her house to look for a missing phone. Police are examining CCTV footage and investigating whether someone known to the victim was involved.

articles.headline: Passenger in Kerala prevents bus accident after driver collapses
articles.summary: A passenger in Alappuzha averted a major crash by taking control of a KSRTC bus after the driver suffered a cardiac arrest. The bus was safely steered into a wall, though the driver later died in the hospital.

articles.headline: Police escort teenage couple to board exams after wedding attempt
articles.summary: A teen couple in Uttar Pradesh was intercepted by police while attempting to marry at a temple during school hours. Cops successfully escorted them to their respective examination centers to complete their Class 12 papers.

articles.headline: The New Indian Express Hosts 38th Edition of Devi Awards
articles.summary: Union Minister Suresh Gopi presented awards to 11 women from diverse fields in Kochi. Winners include scientist A Seema and dancer Kapila Venu for their significant societal impact.

articles.headline: Graded Point System for Driving Licences to Track Serial Offenders
articles.summary: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways plans to implement a point system that could lead to the permanent cancellation of driving licenses for repeat offenders. India currently records over 500,000 road accidents and 180,000 fatalities annually.

articles.headline: Bengaluru East City Corporation notifies 150 dog feeding spots
articles.summary: Authorities have designated 150 official feeding points for street dogs in KR Puram and Mahadevapura to reduce human-animal conflict. Feeding on main roads is now prohibited to streamline animal birth control and vaccination drives.

articles.headline: Environment Minister warns civic bodies over deteriorating air quality
articles.summary: Eshwar Khandre stated that city corporations will face action if the Air Quality Index exceeds 100 in Bengaluru. A meeting with city MLAs will be convened to devise measures to curb rising pollution levels.

articles.headline: GBA provides updates on rejuvenation projects for Bengaluru lakes
articles.summary: Several lakes including Nagawara and Halasuru have been drained for desilting and bund construction as part of a comprehensive development plan. Sarakki lake remains well-maintained while Bellandur undergoes massive desilting of 32 lakh cubic metres.

articles.headline: Supreme Court seeks experts for Aravalis panel while maintaining mining ban
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has asked stakeholders to suggest experts for a committee tasked with defining the Aravali hills and ranges. The court extended a stay on mining in the region until a uniform definition is established.

articles.headline: Minister Khandre warns civic bodies as Bengaluru AQI hits 100
articles.summary: Karnataka's Environment Minister has directed that notices be issued to civic bodies if the city's air quality index exceeds 100. Officials identified road dust and construction activities as primary sources of the worsening pollution.

articles.headline: Bengaluru Local Bodies Face Notices if AQI Breaches 100 Mark
articles.summary: The Karnataka government will issue notices to city corporations if the air quality index exceeds 100 in Bengaluru. Authorities must improve air quality within a specified timeframe or face legal action from the forest and environment department.

articles.headline: BEE considers tougher emission goals as top carmakers meet targets
articles.summary: India's top six carmakers met carbon-dioxide emission targets for fiscal 2024 and 2025, prompting the Bureau of Energy Efficiency to rethink upcoming norms. The proposed CAFE-3 regime may tighten industry ceilings annually from 92.5 gm/km to 77.08 gm/km.

articles.headline: India likely to record unusually hot March this year
articles.summary: Weather sources predict above-average temperatures in key wheat and rapeseed-growing states this March. High heat during the maturity stage could cut yields for the 2026 crop, potentially impacting India’s export and import balance for grains and oils.

articles.headline: Bengaluru South City Corporation to auction properties for tax non-payment
articles.summary: Fifty properties will be auctioned on Friday due to the non-payment of property tax. The auction will take place at the Bommanahalli Joint Commissioner’s office starting at 11 am.

articles.headline: Property transactions in Karnataka likely to get costlier from April
articles.summary: The state government plans to revise the guidance value of land and buildings by 15% to 20%. The move aims to bridge the gap between market rates and government prices and address revenue shortfalls.

articles.headline: New DGCA rules allow free flight ticket changes within 48 hours
articles.summary: Airlines must now offer a 48-hour window for passengers to cancel or amend bookings without additional charges, provided the departure is several days away. The revised norms also mandate refunds within 14 days and free name corrections within 24 hours.

articles.headline: India and UK free trade agreement expected to be implemented by summer
articles.summary: A UK official stated that the bilateral free trade agreement with India is currently undergoing parliamentary procedures and may soon come into force. The deal aims to provide duty-free access for 99% of Indian exports.

articles.headline: US tariff cuts revive interest in Indian footwear manufacturing sector
articles.summary: Asian footwear manufacturers are ramping up production in India targeting the American market after a reduction in tariffs. Several global brands are evaluating capacity expansion to utilize India's non-leather footwear supply chain.

articles.headline: Smartphones become India's top export category for the first time
articles.summary: Driven by Apple's iPhone, smartphone exports from India hit $30.1 billion in 2025, overtaking automotive diesel fuel. Policy measures and performance-linked incentives have helped India emerge as a global manufacturing hub.

articles.headline: Rise of convenience credit leads affluent savers to take personal loans
articles.summary: Bankers report that even customers with sufficient savings are opting for personal loans for expenses like home renovation and travel. The trend is driven by the speed of digital loan approvals and a desire to keep long-term savings intact.

articles.headline: India Plans 6 MMT Strategic Oil Reserve for Energy Security
articles.summary: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas is preparing a cabinet note to create an additional 6 MMT buffer to enable a 90-day strategic reserve. The plan includes a national deepwater exploration mission and positioning India as a global refining hub.

articles.headline: India and Israel Finalize Plan for 50,000 More Indian Workers
articles.summary: Prime Ministers Modi and Netanyahu agreed that up to 50,000 additional Indian workers will move to Israel over the next five years. The workers will primarily fill labor shortages in the construction, caregiver, manufacturing, and restaurant sectors.

articles.headline: Karnataka Orders Swift Action for 28 Pending Ease of Business Services
articles.summary: Industries Minister MB Patil has directed officials to accelerate amendments for 28 pending services spread across revenue and forest departments. The move aims to streamline the single-window system and maintain Karnataka's competitive edge in attracting investment.

articles.headline: Piyush Goyal Holds Fruitful Trade Talks with US Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Secretary Howard Lutnick to discuss expanding bilateral trade and finalizing a special strategic partnership. The talks follow a US Supreme Court ruling that disrupted President Trump's sweeping global tariff plans.

articles.headline: Government Considers Shift to Monthly TDS Returns and Revised HRA Rules
articles.summary: The Income Tax department has received over 13,600 public responses regarding proposed changes to the tax regime starting April 1. Key suggestions include moving from quarterly to monthly TDS returns and reclassifying HRA metro city definitions.

articles.headline: RBI gives compliance breather for small-merchant UPI transactions
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India clarified that Peer-to-Peer Merchant (P2PM) transactions do not require a payment aggregator partner. This move eases KYC and compliance pressures for fintech firms like PhonePe and Paytm in the unorganised retail sector.

articles.headline: India and Israel to resume FTA talks in May
articles.summary: India and Israel signed 16 agreements covering AI, defense, and mobility during Prime Minister Modi's visit. The two countries aim to expedite negotiations for a mutually beneficial free trade agreement starting this May.

articles.headline: Cargill opens largest dairy feed plant in South Asia in Punjab
articles.summary: Global agriculture major Cargill invested ~300 crore to open a 400,000-tonne annual capacity dairy feed plant in Wazirabad. The facility covers 15 acres and is expected to provide employment to nearly 1,000 people in the region.

articles.headline: Govt mandates sale of petrol with 20% ethanol blending from April
articles.summary: The Ministry of Petroleum has directed oil companies to sell petrol blended with up to 20 percent ethanol starting April 1. The move aims to utilize domestic production capacity and has reportedly saved ~1.4 trillion in import bills already.

articles.headline: CEA: AI age brings new responsibilities for financial regulators
articles.summary: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran warned that algorithmic trading and AI-led strategies could cause rapid market shocks across jurisdictions. He urged regulators to update frameworks to detect model-based herd behavior and critical supply chain risks.

articles.headline: Revenue secretary calls for tech-driven Customs reforms
articles.summary: Revenue Secretary Arvind Srivastava emphasized that the next phase of Customs reforms must rely on advanced technology and stakeholder trust. The ICEGATE 2.0 initiative is expected to create a unified national trade interface to enhance global competitiveness.

articles.headline: India unveils comprehensive overhaul of national accounts with new GDP series
articles.summary: The statistics ministry is set to release a new GDP series with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the 2011-12 series. The revision will introduce double deflation and leverage new data sources like GST and e-Vahan for more accurate economic measurement.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia bans poultry imports from 40 countries including India
articles.summary: Saudi Arabia suspended poultry meat and table egg imports from 40 nations as a precaution against bird flu. Indian exporters expect minimal impact as the Saudi market accounts for a very small portion of their total pie.

articles.headline: Lower US tariffs may improve capital flows to India says MPC
articles.summary: MPC member Saugata Bhattacharya stated that if final US tariffs are lower than expected, global growth and trade could receive a significant boost. This clarity would likely improve foreign investment confidence and capital flows into the Indian economy.

articles.headline: RBI conducts workshop with 60 banks to tackle financial cyber fraud
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India held a two-day session focused on strengthening governance and internal controls to mitigate digital fraud. Participants from the Ministry of Home Affairs and cyber police discussed advanced technological interventions to protect the banking system.

articles.headline: US solar duty spurs domestic industry demand for SEZ benefits
articles.summary: After the US imposed a 125.87 percent duty on Indian solar imports, the domestic industry is urging the government to allow SEZ units to sell locally. Experts warn that the duty could double the landed cost of Indian panels in the US.

articles.headline: AgriStack digital infrastructure may be the next UPI for farmers
articles.summary: The government is building a digital network to create IDs for 110 million farmers, linking registries with land and crop data. The project aims to enable easy access to benefits and could save ~40,000 crore in fertilizer subsidies.

articles.headline: FPI flows in February reach highest level in 17 months
articles.summary: Foreign portfolio investors turned net buyers in February, investing nearly ~25,000 crore in Indian equities. Conversely, domestic mutual funds became net sellers for the first time since April 2023, pulling out about ~1,000 crore.

articles.headline: Nimhans research questions existing theory on Parkinson’s disease progression
articles.summary: A new study published in Communications Biology suggests changes in alpha-synuclein protein act as an early trigger for Lewy body formation. Researchers are now planning to develop a biomarker for early detection of the disease.

articles.headline: Bengaluru to witness total lunar eclipse on March third
articles.summary: Residents in Bengaluru, Mysuru, and Mangaluru will have the opportunity to observe the final phase of a total lunar eclipse on March 3. The moon is expected to rise at 6:28 pm during the umbral phase.

articles.headline: ISRO transports tracking antenna to Cocos Island for Gaganyaan mission
articles.summary: ISRO has completed the transportation of a tracking antenna to Australia's Cocos Island to support India's human spaceflight program. The telemetry station will provide crucial ascent phase tracking for the Gaganyaan orbital module.

articles.headline: Explorer Ash Dykes Leads Daring Amazon Expedition in New Discovery+ Series
articles.summary: The docuseries follows a team navigating the remote Suriname rainforest to reveal Earth's last true wildernesses. They face challenges from extreme terrain and unpredictable wildlife.

articles.headline: Bengaluru sees rise in book clubs with unique formats
articles.summary: New reading groups in the city are focusing on unique concepts like discussing hated books or reading during public transport commutes. The 'Bus Reads' initiative encourages group reading on BMTC buses to build community.

articles.headline: Arjun Sajnani’s revival of play Amadeus to debut in March
articles.summary: The contemporary production of Peter Shaffer’s classic play will run at Chowdiah Memorial Hall from March 6 to 8. The story explores the legendary rivalry between Mozart and Antonio Salieri using new visuals and audio technology.

articles.headline: NGMA Bengaluru hosts Lenscape Kerala photography exhibition
articles.summary: The exhibition features 100 works by ten acclaimed photographers documenting heritage and wildlife across Kerala. Curated by Uma Nair, the show opens today at the National Gallery of Modern Art.

articles.headline: Essay explores moral complexities in film Hamnet and Shakespeare's life
articles.summary: A cultural analysis discusses the film Hamnet and its portrayal of William Shakespeare's grief. The piece questions whether an artist's personal moral failings should disqualify their creative achievements or if art should be separate from biography.

articles.headline: Play ‘A Woman Or Not To Be’ Reimagines Shakespeare’s Tragedy
articles.summary: Directed by Vinay Kumar, the Adishakti Laboratory production explores grief and power through physical theatre. The play features a young woman at its center and incorporates pop-cultural references at the Bangalore International Centre.

articles.headline: Comedian Rohan Joshi Performs Stand-Up Special ‘Getting There’ in Bengaluru
articles.summary: The stand-up special focuses on a New Year existential spiral and the reluctant transition into middle age. The performance is scheduled for February 28 at Phoenix Mall of Asia.

articles.headline: JW Kitchen Hosts Ramadan Nights With Traditional Iftar-Inspired Spread
articles.summary: The event features dates, jallab, kebabs, lamb biryani, and Arabic desserts such as kunafa and baklava. The festival runs from February 20 to 28 at the JW Marriott Hotel.

articles.headline: Museum of Art and Photography Launches Monograph on Artist Jivya Soma Mashe
articles.summary: French art critic Hervé Perdriolle will host a talk and book signing at the Mazumdar-Shaw Auditorium. The event is held in conjunction with the permanent exhibition ‘Beneath the Turning Sky’.

articles.headline: Barbeque Nation Presents Royal Bengal Table Curated by Chef Suraj Thapa
articles.summary: The Rajbari-inspired spread features traditional Bengali dishes like pabda macher jhal and nolen gurer payesh. The food festival is hosted at the Sarjapur Road outlet until March 1.

articles.headline: GoSwadeshi Utsav Showcases Indian Handloom and Craft Traditions in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Over 120 artisan stalls are gathering at Jayamahal Palace to celebrate national award-winning makers and social enterprises. The five-day event includes folk performances by Karnataka Mahila Yakshagana.

articles.headline: Indian Craft Brewery Hosts High-Energy Live Performance by Iham Kavyam Experience
articles.summary: The Saturday Night Live event features a set combining commanding vocals and intricate instrumental work. The performance is scheduled for February 28 at the Nagavara location.

articles.headline: The Ritz-Carlton Marks Year of the Horse With Special Chinese Menu
articles.summary: The celebration at Yàn features lion dance performances and a menu including lobster, seabass, and longevity noodles. The festive event runs from February 17 to March 3.

articles.headline: Glass Kitchen & Bar Launches Coastal Menu Featuring Southern Shoreline Flavours
articles.summary: The new menu titled ‘A Coast Apart’ offers regional favourites like Ghee Roast Prawn and Meen Pollichathu. It explores diverse culinary traditions from Karnataka, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh.

articles.headline: Tijouri Hosts Special Pop-Up Featuring Family Recipes by Choudhary Tara Chand
articles.summary: The seven-course surprise menu includes traditional dishes like Mutton Nihari and Chicken Patiala Tikka. The event is hosted at the Radisson Blu Hotel until March 1.

articles.headline: Renaissance Bengaluru Race Course Hotel Hosts Global Stew Festival
articles.summary: The ‘World of Stews’ showcase features slow-cooked recipes from India and abroad, including Moroccan Chickpea Tagine. The festival highlights the depth of flavor achieved through gentle cooking techniques.

articles.headline: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi Discusses His Strategic Approach to Bollywood Career
articles.summary: Following the release of ‘Do Deewane Seher Mein’, the actor reflects on his journey from ‘Gully Boy’ to mainstream success. He emphasizes staying true to his craft as an outsider.

articles.headline: Comedian Kaneez Surka Returns to India With New Tour ‘Foreign Return’
articles.summary: After four years in New York, the comedian is touring Indian cities with a show exploring identity and nationality. She discusses the evolution of her voice and the importance of authenticity.

articles.headline: Kannada Play ‘Kattala Neralu’ Explores Themes of Memory and Trauma
articles.summary: Directed by Venkatesh Prasad, this adaptation of David Harrower’s ‘Blackbird’ focuses on the complicated reunion of two individuals. The production addresses societal silences regarding abuse and power.

articles.headline: Visual Artist Dr Akhter Husain Presents Solo Exhibition ‘Vedic Inspirations’
articles.summary: The exhibition at Kumarakrupa Road features 25 mixed media works using the ‘Akhterism’ technique. The artist explores philosophical inquiries into consciousness through architectural motifs and stones.

articles.headline: Musicians Lola G and Tomasz Bura Bring Jazz Classics to Bengaluru
articles.summary: The duo will perform ‘A Night of Gershwin’ at Windmills, featuring jazz standards and Hollywood classics. The show fusion of classical training with cinematic storytelling and improvisation.

articles.headline: Independent Arts Space Medai Relocates to MG Road Campus
articles.summary: Founder B Charles announced the move to the Good Shepherd campus to provide better parking and accessibility. The new venue opens on March 1 with a production of ‘The Kite Runner’.

articles.headline: Director Sujay Ghorpadkar Brings Hitchcock’s ‘Dial M for Murder’ to Stage
articles.summary: Staged with Bangalore Little Theatre, this production is based on the original 1953 play by Frederick Knott. The set design incorporates both a living room and corridor to build suspense.

articles.headline: MAP Academy Relaunches as Impart to Expand Access to Art History
articles.summary: The new digital platform offers a free, publicly accessible encyclopedia of over 10,000 years of South Asian visual culture. Director Varun Nayar aims to democratize knowledge through this archive.

articles.headline: Shillong Rock Band Bending Waves Gains National Attention With New Singles
articles.summary: The alternative rock group, known for tracks like ‘Medicine’, is currently recording their debut album. They were recently awarded Best Performing Band by the Meghalaya Grassroots Music Project.

articles.headline: Monarch: Legacy of Monsters Returns for Second Season on Apple TV
articles.summary: The series continues the story of siblings uncovering family links to the mysterious Monarch organization. It features a dual timeline exploring Titan-related secrets from the 1950s to today.

articles.headline: Malayalam Thriller ‘Roslin’ Set for Premiere on JioHotstar Platform
articles.summary: Starring Meena and Vineeth, the series follows a young woman whose nightmares appear to come true. The plot blurs reality following the arrival of a mysterious houseguest.

articles.headline: Konkona Sena Sharma Stars in Workplace Drama ‘Accused’ on Netflix
articles.summary: The film depicts a respected surgeon's life spiraling after allegations of sexual misconduct. It explores how public scrutiny and bias affect personal reputations and marriages.

articles.headline: Psychological Thriller ‘Bugonia’ Explores Paranoia and Alien Conspiracy Theories
articles.summary: Two conspiracy-obsessed men kidnap a powerful pharmaceutical CEO, believing she is an alien. The film features a psychological power struggle as she fights to outsmart her captors.

articles.headline: Comedian Chris Fleming Brings New Stand-Up Special to JioHotstar
articles.summary: The performance features personal stories and sharp takes on modern relationships and social habits. Fleming utilizes bold characters to create an unpredictable comedic experience.

articles.headline: Luxury travel to Antarctica bypassing the Drake Passage with air-cruises
articles.summary: New expedition models allow travelers to fly directly to the White Continent, bypassing notorious rough seas. These high-end trips can cost over $30,000 per person and follow strict environmental protocols to protect the remote landscape.

articles.headline: Inside the world finest perfume museums and heritage fragrance ateliers
articles.summary: Museums in Paris, Grasse, and London are preserving historic scents and offering bespoke perfume creation workshops. These institutions allow visitors to explore rare formulations and understand the evolution of modern perfumery.

articles.headline: New luxury shopping map prioritizes participation and craft over brand density
articles.summary: Luxury shopping is shifting toward sourcing directly from workshops and ateliers in cities like Florence, Kanazawa, and Jaipur. Travellers are seeking fewer but more meaningful objects that reflect local craftsmanship and heritage.

articles.headline: Wildlife photography tips for capturing untamed animals in the jungle
articles.summary: Wildlife photographers emphasize patience, ethical distance, and the use of specialized lenses for capturing animals in their natural habitat. Successful jungle excursions require knowledge of animal calls and choosing functional, neutral-colored gear.

articles.headline: Local groups help Bengaluru seniors combat loneliness through upskilling
articles.summary: Collectives like Happy60plus and Silver Surfers are promoting social engagement for the elderly through online yoga, hobby circles, and international travel. These groups aim to support the growing population of single seniors in the city.

articles.headline: Protein awareness rises in Bengaluru but daily intake remains low
articles.summary: While nutritional awareness is increasing, many residents fail to meet daily protein requirements due to carbohydrate-heavy Indian diets. Experts suggest that consistent intake across all meals is necessary to avoid muscle mass loss.

articles.headline: Health Expert Ritesh Bawri Emphasizes Homeostasis for Preventive Healthcare
articles.summary: The founder of nira balance argues that chronic diseases are signals of systemic disruption rather than isolated conditions. He advocates for biomarker-led protocols to restore the body’s internal balance.

articles.headline: Nutritionist Luke Coutinho Recommends Shikakai for Scalp Health and Hair Growth
articles.summary: The traditional Ayurvedic ingredient is highlighted as a natural cleanser that calms inflammation and reduces dandruff. It contains vitamins A, C, E, and K to strengthen roots.

articles.headline: EAC-PM Warns Rising Tobacco Use Threatens Public Health and Finance
articles.summary: A working paper by the Economic Advisory Council to the PM highlights a 55% surge in urban tobacco consumption between 2011-12 and 2023-24. The council calls for rationalizing tobacco taxation and tighter enforcement against illicit sales to safeguard the economy.

articles.headline: CDSCO modifies drug testing rules to expedite manufacturing approvals
articles.summary: The Centre now allows pharmaceutical companies to begin lab testing immediately after filing applications rather than waiting for technical scrutiny. The new rules, effective June 2026, aim to reduce approval timelines and promote ease of doing business.

articles.headline: Wellness retreats offer soul journeys through meditation and ancient healing
articles.summary: Luxury wellness centers are integrating Ayurveda, neuroscience, and nature immersion to help travelers manage burnout and stress. Immersive programs can cost several lakhs of rupees, focusing on mindfulness and long-term vitality.

articles.headline: Azim Premji University students protest against FIR over campus discussion
articles.summary: Students boycotted classes demanding the withdrawal of an FIR against Spark Reading Circle members. The FIR was filed following a discussion on the 1991 Kunan Pashpora incident, which university officials claimed was unauthorized.

articles.headline: Innovation labs to be established at 60 state residential schools
articles.summary: The Science and Technology Department will set up Nehru Stream Labs and innovation centers to promote scientific curiosity at the grassroots. The initiative aims to move beyond textbook learning for rural students.

articles.headline: Students break JNU gate in bid to march to education ministry
articles.summary: JNU students clashed with police for two hours after breaking the varsity's main gate during a protest against alleged casteist remarks by the Vice Chancellor. The incident resulted in several detentions and injuries among the protesters.

articles.headline: Karnataka considers mobile phone ban for children under age sixteen
articles.summary: Education Minister Madhu Bangarappa stated that a decision on banning mobile phones for under-16 children will involve consultations with parents and experts. The initiative aims to combat phone addiction and student distraction.

articles.headline: Karnataka PU department mandates online demand and payment for textbooks
articles.summary: Starting from the 2026-27 academic year, private PU colleges must submit textbook requirements and payments online in advance. The move aims to eliminate waste and financial losses caused by surplus unsold stock.

articles.headline: Steep fees for mandatory CBSE bridge course concern primary teachers
articles.summary: Teachers have raised concerns over a Rs 25,000 fee for a mandatory six-month bridge course required for BEd holders. The training is essential for validating the employment of primary school teachers as per Supreme Court orders.

articles.headline: Indian student enrolments at US universities drop by 45 percent
articles.summary: A new white paper reports a significant decline in Indian students enrolling at US universities due to visa delays and high costs. Meanwhile, international applications for graduate management programs in India have risen by 25%.

articles.headline: Concealed camera found in Guwahati TISS girls' hostel bathroom
articles.summary: A student discovered a camera hidden inside a soap packet at the TISS Guwahati campus, leading to student protests. Police have registered a case and the institute is reviewing its security protocols following the privacy violation.

articles.headline: Account closure request uncovers Rs 590-crore bank fraud in Chandigarh
articles.summary: A former manager at IDFC First Bank allegedly masterminded the country's biggest bank fraud of the year by siphoning funds using forged cheques. The siphoned money belonged to 18 government departments in Haryana and Chandigarh.

articles.headline: Thousands of workers rampage at Gujarat steel plant over wages
articles.summary: Migrant laborers employed at the ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel plant in Hazira turned violent, damaging vehicles and setting a car on fire. The workers were demanding wage increases, overtime pay, and reduced working hours.

articles.headline: Goyal and Lutnick discuss expanding India-US trade partnership
articles.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick to discuss economic cooperation. The meeting occurs amid uncertainty over reciprocal duty structures following a US Supreme Court ruling.

articles.headline: SEBI introduces Life Cycle Funds and scraps solution-oriented schemes
articles.summary: The markets regulator revamped the classification framework for mutual funds to ensure schemes remain 'true-to-label'. The new rules aim to prevent exaggerated return claims in scheme names to protect retail investors.

articles.headline: DGCA rules no extra charge for flight changes within 48 hours
articles.summary: New regulations effective March 26 will allow passengers to cancel or amend flight bookings within a 48-hour 'look-in' period for free. Airlines are also barred from charging for name corrections pointed out within 24 hours.

articles.headline: Nvidia delivers strong results as investors seek long term AI certainty
articles.summary: Chipmaker Nvidia reported a 73% surge in quarterly revenue, but its stock remained volatile as investors sought more assurance on AI growth. CEO Jensen Huang expressed confidence that customer cash flows from AI investments are growing.

articles.headline: Sebi approves launch of life cycle funds for retail investors
articles.summary: Markets regulator Sebi has allowed fund houses to launch life cycle mutual funds designed for long-term goals like retirement. These schemes will gradually shift asset allocation from equities to lower-risk assets as they approach maturity.

articles.headline: Uber India reports FY25 sales of 3,849 crore with widened losses
articles.summary: Uber's India unit posted a modest 2.3% revenue growth while net losses reached Rs 1,511 crore in FY25. The results highlight intensifying competition in the local ride-hailing market from rivals like Rapido.

articles.headline: Aavishkaar Capital leads 60 crore funding in debt relief platform FREED
articles.summary: Impact investor Aavishkaar Capital has invested Rs 60 crore in FREED to support India's growing debt resolution infrastructure. The startup helps consumers manage debt as unsecured retail lending continues to rise.

articles.headline: Zarf Restaurant Partners With Amrut Distilleries for Curated Dining Experience
articles.summary: The collaboration features a set menu paired with a restaurant-exclusive single malt by Amrut Distilleries. Notable dishes include Mushroom Ki Galouti and slow-cooked Dal-E-Zarf.

articles.headline: Fine-Dining Restaurant Navu Moves to New Bistro Space on MG Road
articles.summary: Chef co-owners Kanishka Sharma and Pallavi Menon have transitioned the limited-seat dinner format into an expansive 50-seater bistro. The new menu features refined dishes like Mushroom Parfait.

articles.headline: Club Destini Honored for Best Customer Experience in Nightlife Category
articles.summary: The Electronic City venue received the Food Connoisseur Award within its first year of operation. Founder Lokesh Gowda announced plans to introduce an unlimited weekday lunch buffet.

articles.headline: Jewellery Label Misho Launches First Ready-to-Wear Fashion Collection
articles.summary: Designer Suhani Parekh has transitioned her sculptural design language into a monochromatic apparel line titled Volume One. The collection features architectural silhouettes in silk, organza, and taffeta.

articles.headline: Designer Amit Aggarwal Relaunches Contemporary Prêt Line AM:IT
articles.summary: The relaunch features a dedicated brand store at Dhan Mill designed as an experiential retail space. The collection utilizes upcycled Banarasi textiles and signature polymers to create structured wear.

articles.headline: Sebi Tightens Mutual Fund Classification and Portfolio Overlap Rules
articles.summary: The capital markets regulator has capped portfolio overlaps at 50% for thematic mutual fund schemes and mandated uniform naming across categories. Sebi also scrapped the solution-oriented schemes category and prohibited emphasizing returns in scheme names.

articles.headline: Titan MD Says Gold Buying Habits Align with Surge in Prices
articles.summary: Titan Managing Director Ajoy Chawla stated that consumers are shifting to lighter weights and modular designs as gold prices rise. He noted that the online betting ban and GST rationalization have freed up consumer spending for branded jewelry.

articles.headline: NCLAT Upholds Class Action Suit Against Jindal Poly Films
articles.summary: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal upheld a shareholder lawsuit claiming ₹2,500 crore in damages for alleged undervalued asset sales. Minority shareholders allege fraudulent acts by promoters involving investments in an affiliated power company.

articles.headline: Cargill Invests ₹300 Crore in Second Punjab Dairy Feed Plant
articles.summary: Minneapolis-based Cargill is building a new 400,000-tonne annual capacity facility near Wazirabad to modernize animal husbandry in India. The plant is expected to create 1,000 jobs and improve milk productivity for local dairy farmers.

articles.headline: DII Flows into Equity Hit 10-Month Low in February
articles.summary: Domestic institutional flows into Indian stocks slowed to ₹26,130 crore this month, the lowest since April 2025. Analysts attribute the decline to underwhelming market returns and a shift in investor interest toward gold and silver.

articles.headline: Investors Turn to Multi-Asset Funds for Stable Returns
articles.summary: Assets under management for multi-asset funds grew 72% over the last year as investors seek to cushion against equity volatility. These funds delivered 23% returns on average, significantly outperforming the Nifty 50 due to exposure to gold and silver.

articles.headline: NARCL Plans ₹900 Crore Bid for Stressed Videocon Oil Ventures
articles.summary: The National Asset Reconstruction Company is set to submit a bid for Videocon Oil Ventures, which has admitted claims totaling ₹30,640 crore. The acquisition involves complex overseas legal structures and follows six months of negotiations with lenders.

articles.headline: Banks Face Higher Funding Costs for CDs and Bulk Deposits
articles.summary: Year-end credit demand and tight liquidity may push three-month Certificate of Deposit (CD) rates to 7.50% in March. Banks are struggling with high loan-to-deposit ratios and system outflows linked to GST payments and credit demand.

articles.headline: Motilal Oswal Alternates Reaches ₹1,700 Crore First Close for Debt Fund
articles.summary: The India Credit Excellence Fund-I has reached its first close, targeting a total corpus of ₹3,000 crore for secured private lending. The fund will focus on mid-market corporates seeking flexible capital solutions outside traditional banking channels.

articles.headline: HDFC Bank Mandates Biometric Authentication for Locker Access
articles.summary: HDFC Bank has made Aadhaar-linked biometric authentication mandatory for locker holders to enhance security following incidents of theft. The bank also doubled annual locker fees in metro cities to ₹5,000 to align with updated regulatory standards.

articles.headline: Nvidia Fourth Quarter Profit Nearly Doubles to $43 Billion
articles.summary: Chip giant Nvidia reported a record profit of $43 billion for the quarter, driven by an insatiable global demand for AI-powering semiconductors. Total sales of chips for AI data centers rose 71% to reach $61.7 billion.

articles.headline: Constelli Deftech Raises $20 Million Led by General Catalyst
articles.summary: Hyderabad-based defense technology firm Constelli has secured $20 million in funding to develop next-generation electronic warfare and communication payloads. The capital will be used for R&D and rapid prototyping of systems for drones and satellites.

articles.headline: Info Edge Sets Up ₹250 Crore Fund for Growth-Stage Tech Bets
articles.summary: Naukri.com parent Info Edge has launched B8 Fund-I to invest in later-stage technology companies. This new vehicle complements the firm's existing early-stage investment platforms like Info Edge Ventures and Redstart Labs.

articles.headline: NFRA to Release Audit Inspection Findings for 10 Top Firms
articles.summary: The National Financial Reporting Authority will conclude annual inspections of firms including EY, PwC, Deloitte, and KPMG by the end of March. The review focuses on audit quality standards and the effectiveness of internal governance frameworks.

articles.headline: New smartphone PLI may be linked to value addition
articles.summary: The government is considering linking incentives for mobile phone manufacturing to the level of domestic value addition achieved by companies. While the original target was 40 percent, actual value addition is now expected to reach only 18-20 percent by fiscal 2026.

articles.headline: Transition path for NBFCs to become banks in offing
articles.summary: The Department of Financial Services is discussing a transition framework for large non-banking financial companies to convert into universal banks. The proposal mirrors existing rules that allow small finance banks to transition after a five-year performance track record.

articles.headline: Affordability keeps ICE relevant as buyers warm up to hybrids
articles.summary: Over half of Indian car buyers refuse to spend more than ~15 lakh, keeping internal combustion engine vehicles as the market anchor. A Deloitte study shows hybrids have emerged as the preferred transition pathway over battery electric vehicles due to charging infrastructure concerns.

articles.headline: ASGN appoints Sangita Singh as president for India and international
articles.summary: NYSE-listed ASGN Incorporated appointed Sangita Singh to a new role to accelerate global growth and expand digital engineering capabilities. The move follows the company's recent intent to acquire Quinnox, which has a large offshore delivery footprint in India.

articles.headline: Jio Financial Services infuses ~2,000 crore in its subsidiary Jio Credit
articles.summary: Jio Financial Services Ltd has invested ~2,000 crore in its wholly-owned NBFC subsidiary to fund business operations. The investment was made at a premium of ~585.70 per equity share to support business growth.

articles.headline: Apple likely to produce 30% of iPhones in India soon
articles.summary: The government expects Apple to shift 30 percent of its global iPhone production to India within a few years. Despite a US Supreme Court ruling on China tariffs, officials believe Apple remains committed to India as a trusted supply chain source.

articles.headline: Axis Bank seeks RBI nod to retain bulk stake in subsidiary
articles.summary: Axis Bank has approached the RBI to retain maximum equity in Axis Finance, its wholly owned NBFC, rather than diluting a large portion. Revised central bank guidelines now allow multiple entities within a banking group to operate in overlapping business lines.

articles.headline: Walmart to pay $100 million to settle deceptive earnings charges
articles.summary: Walmart agreed to a settlement with the US Federal Trade Commission over allegations that it misled delivery drivers about tips and base pay. The complaint alleged that drivers in the SparkDriver program lost tens of millions of dollars in earnings.

articles.headline: Nvidia rosy forecast shows AI boom remains strong despite share slump
articles.summary: Nvidia predicted fiscal first-quarter sales of $78 billion, significantly higher than Wall Street estimates. However, shares fell 5 percent as investors worried about the sustainability of returns from massive spending on AI hardware.

articles.headline: Sebi broadens equity MF scope and allows gold exposure
articles.summary: The Securities and Exchange Board of India now allows active equity mutual funds to invest in gold and silver to navigate market volatility. New categories like life cycle funds and sectoral debt funds were also introduced to encourage goal-based investing.

articles.headline: Capacity-build delivers CDMO growth and higher margins for Laurus Labs
articles.summary: Laurus Labs shares rose after the company reported 26 percent revenue growth for the third quarter of fiscal 2026. The firm’s investment in its CDMO segment has seen quarterly run rates double to ~500 crore over the last two years.

articles.headline: Liquidity stress rises in large smallcap mutual fund schemes
articles.summary: Stress test reports show that Quant Small Cap Fund would need 102 days to liquidate half its portfolio, double the time required a year ago. Average liquidation periods for top schemes have nearly doubled as fund sizes grow amid volatile market conditions.

articles.headline: Indian fashion designers pivot to jewellery for top line boost
articles.summary: Designers like Manish Malhotra and Sabyasachi Mukherjee are diversifying into high jewellery as consumers view it as an investment. Sabyasachi's jewellery line already generates ~150 crore in revenue, with plans to expand significantly over the next decade.

articles.headline: India mocks Pakistan as 'la-la land' over Kashmir budget comparison
articles.summary: At the UN Human Rights Council, India stated that Jammu and Kashmir's development budget is double the bailout package Pakistan recently sought from the IMF. India's representative rejected Islamabad's allegations regarding the region's democratic record.

articles.headline: Afghanistan launches retaliatory strikes on Pakistani border outposts
articles.summary: Taliban forces claimed to have captured 15 Pakistani outposts following heavy clashes triggered by Pakistani air strikes. The escalation comes as militant attacks in northwest Pakistan have killed nearly 20 people in two days.

articles.headline: Afghanistan claims Pakistani soldiers killed and captured in border clashes
articles.summary: Taliban authorities reported killing and capturing several Pakistani soldiers following retaliatory strikes along the frontier. The offensive follows a series of recent border clashes and Pakistani airstrikes on Afghan territory.

articles.headline: True Crime Docuseries ‘Evil Lives Here’ Debuts New Stories on Discovery+
articles.summary: The three-episode series features first-person accounts from people who lived with individuals who committed horrific crimes. It explores the realization of missed warning signs within trusted relationships.

articles.headline: US and Ukraine Discuss $800 Billion Post-War Reconstruction Package
articles.summary: Officials from Ukraine and the US met in Geneva to outline a 10-year reconstruction plan despite ongoing Russian missile and drone attacks. Kyiv aims to attract massive public and private investment to rebuild energy and critical infrastructure destroyed in the conflict.

articles.headline: Merkel calls for AI regulation and multilateralism in memorial lecture
articles.summary: Former German Chancellor Angela Merkel emphasized that giving up on multilateral cooperation is not an option despite rising global protectionism. She called for international regulation of AI and social media, citing their impact on democratic institutions.

articles.headline: Hong Kong’s Jimmy Lai wins rare appeal in fraud case
articles.summary: An appellate court quashed fraud convictions against activist media magnate Jimmy Lai, marking a rare legal victory. However, the 78-year-old will remain in prison due to a separate 20-year sentence under national security laws.

articles.headline: IMF warns US tariff upheaval risks harming buoyant economy
articles.summary: The International Monetary Fund stated that uncertainty around sweeping US trade policies could represent a larger-than-expected drag on economic activity. The Fund noted that import taxes might not pass through to consumers as efficiently as predicted.

articles.headline: Chinese women finding romance with AI chatbots despite government warnings
articles.summary: Rising numbers of young women in China are using AI companions to share routines and anxieties, opting for virtual partners over marriage. This trend complicates government efforts to reverse a shrinking population and record-low birth rates.

articles.headline: Talks with US very intense and serious according to Iran
articles.summary: Nuclear negotiations between the US and Iran in Geneva progressed intensely as a March deadline for a deal approaches. Iran stated it would not allow its highly enriched uranium to be moved out of the country during the Omani-mediated talks.

articles.headline: India crush Zimbabwe by 72 runs to stay in tournament hunt
articles.summary: India posted a mammoth 256/4, the highest ever total in the World Cup, powered by half-centuries from Abhishek Sharma and Hardik Pandya. Zimbabwe was restricted to 184/6 despite an unbeaten 97 from Brian Bennett.

articles.headline: Mayank Agarwal hundred keeps Karnataka afloat in Ranji Trophy final
articles.summary: Captain Mayank Agarwal scored an unbeaten 130 to lead Karnataka to 220/5 against Jammu & Kashmir's first innings total of 584. J&K's Auqib Nabi took 3/32, putting the hosts under significant pressure on day three.

articles.headline: India defeats Zimbabwe by 72 runs in T20 World Cup match
articles.summary: India's campaign returned to track as they posted a record 256/4 against Zimbabwe in Chennai. Abhishek Sharma scored a half-century and the victory sets up a direct quarterfinal against the West Indies.

articles.headline: New Zealand prepares to face England for spot in semifinals
articles.summary: New Zealand aims to secure a semifinal berth with a win against England in Colombo. Coach Rob Walter noted the team's 'street-smart' ability to solve problems on spin-friendly tracks will be crucial.

articles.headline: Ousted Sri Lanka team seeks answers after T20 World Cup exit
articles.summary: Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka apologized to fans for the team's performance following a 61-run loss to New Zealand. He also urged government intervention to mitigate social media negativity affecting the team's mental health.

articles.headline: Ranji Trophy Final: Auqib Nabi Puts Jammu and Kashmir in Command
articles.summary: Fast bowler Auqib Nabi's three-wicket haul rocked Karnataka’s top order in the Ranji Trophy final. Despite a century from Mayank Agarwal, Karnataka trailed by 364 runs at the end of the third day's play.

articles.headline: India Thrash Zimbabwe Following Explosive Batting by Pandya and Abhishek
articles.summary: India posted a massive total of 256 for 4 against Zimbabwe in Chennai, anchored by Abhishek Sharma's 55 and Hardik Pandya's unbeaten 50. The victory puts India's T20 World Cup campaign back on track ahead of their virtual knockout match.

articles.headline: Supreme Court bans NCERT chapter on corruption in judiciary
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has prohibited the circulation of a Class 8 Social Science textbook containing a chapter titled "Corruption in the Judiciary." The bench stated that the content undermined the institution's dignity and issued show-cause notices to Education Ministry officials regarding potential contempt proceedings. This order aims to preserve the sanctity and public trust in the judicial system.

articles.headline: Supreme Court bans NCERT book over chapter on judiciary corruption
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has imposed a blanket ban on a Class 8 social science textbook, labeling a section on judicial corruption a "deep-rooted conspiracy." The court ordered the immediate seizure of all physical and digital copies currently in circulation to protect the judiciary's dignity. Additionally, contempt notices were issued to directors of the NCERT and the education department for the offensive content.

articles.headline: India and Israel elevate ties to special strategic partnership
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu have upgraded bilateral relations to a special strategic partnership while agreeing to fast-track a free trade deal. The two nations signed 17 agreements and 16 MoUs focusing on joint weapon development, technology transfers, and cybersecurity. Cooperation will also expand into artificial intelligence, agriculture, and the integration of India's UPI with Israel's Masav system.

articles.headline: Amit Shah vows to deport every infiltrator from Bihar and Bengal
articles.summary: During a visit to Seemanchal, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed confidence in a BJP victory in the upcoming West Bengal elections. He vowed that the new government would identify and deport every single infiltrator from Bihar and Bengal to protect national security. Shah claimed that illegal infiltration is disturbing the region's demographic balance and poses a significant threat to the country.

articles.headline: Sunetra Pawar unanimously elected as new national president of NCP
articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar has been unanimously elected as the national president of the NCP following the death of her husband, Ajit Pawar. The party's national committee also appointed Praful Patel as working president and nominated Parth Pawar for a vacant Rajya Sabha seat. Sunetra Pawar is expected to contest the Baramati assembly bypoll as part of her new leadership role within the party.

articles.headline: Namma Metro increases Yellow Line train frequency during peak hours
articles.summary: Starting this Friday, Namma Metro will increase train frequency on Bengaluru's Yellow Line to every nine minutes during peak hours. An eighth trainset has been inducted to reduce waiting times and improve non-peak service, which will now run every 14 minutes. The BMRCL implemented these changes following passenger feedback to enhance the overall commuting experience.

articles.headline: Social media platforms must share revenue and take responsibility for content
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated that digital platforms must fairly compensate content creators, including news media and influencers, for hosted content. He argued that platforms are no longer pure intermediaries and must be held liable for deepfakes, misinformation, and harmful synthetic media. Vaishnaw emphasized the need for adequate safety measures for women and children to maintain public trust in internet services.

articles.headline: CBI registers fresh bank fraud case against Anil Ambani and RCom
articles.summary: The CBI has registered a new case against Anil Ambani and Reliance Communications involving an alleged Rs 2,220 crore fraud following a complaint from Bank of Baroda. Investigators are probing claims that loan funds were diverted through shell companies between 2013 and 2017. Following the vacation of a stay order, the agency conducted raids at Ambani’s Mumbai residence and RCom offices as part of the probe.

articles.headline: NSE invites investment banks to pitch for $2.5 billion IPO
articles.summary: The National Stock Exchange has issued a request for proposals to 15 investment banks, including JPMorgan and Kotak Mahindra Capital, to manage its upcoming initial public offering. The long-awaited IPO is expected to be a $2.5 billion offer for sale, with existing shareholders divesting up to 4.5 percent of the company’s equity. The stake sale is tentatively scheduled to take place in April as investors look to offload their holdings.

articles.headline: WEF President Borge Brende resigns following Jeffrey Epstein investigation
articles.summary: Borge Brende has stepped down as President and CEO of the World Economic Forum following an investigation into his past business dinners with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Brende stated he resigned to ensure the Forum could continue its global work without the distraction of his personal associations. Managing Director Alois Zwinggi will serve as interim leader while the board searches for a permanent successor.

articles.headline: Vinicius Junior leads Real Madrid to Champions League knockout stages
articles.summary: Real Madrid secured their place in the Champions League last 16 with a 2-1 victory over Benfica, winning 3-1 on aggregate after a late goal by Vinicius Junior. Meanwhile, defending champions PSG also progressed to the knockout stages after defeating rivals Monaco in their latest match. Vinicius Junior celebrated his decisive goal with a signature dance, marking a successful night for the Spanish giants.

articles.headline: South Africa crush West Indies to seal T20 World Cup semi-final
articles.summary: Captain Aiden Markram scored an unbeaten 82 to lead South Africa to a dominant nine-wicket victory over the West Indies in Ahmedabad. The result confirms South Africa's place in the semifinals and keeps them as the only unbeaten team in the tournament. The loss severely impacted the West Indies' net run rate, while South Africa moves forward as a top contender for the title.
